member.name: T:Fluentx.Expresser`1
member.summary: Experimental class: Expresser expresses an entity's properties in a strongly typed format using lambda expressions, instead of creating too many POCO's you can use the expresser to transfer the entity's data that you want.

member.name: M:Fluentx.Expresser`1.Set(`0,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}}[])
member.summary: Expressers all direct public properties and fields within the entity EXCEPT what has has been specified.

member.name: M:Fluentx.Extensions.WordCount(System.String,Fluentx.Extensions.WordCountAlgorithm)
member.summary: Counts the words within the specified strings, two algorithms can be used, Regex is the default one used: more accurate but slower. Loop method is much much faster but less accurate.

member.name: T:Fluentx.Extensions.WordCountAlgorithm
member.summary: Enumeration to specify which algorithm to use when counting words for the WordCount extension method

member.name: F:Fluentx.Extensions.WordCountAlgorithm.Regex
member.summary: Uses regular expressions to count words, its not fast for long strings but its accurate in terms of comparing to Microsoft Word, deviation is 0.02%. Note: this benchmark is taken from http://www.dotnetperls.com

member.name: F:Fluentx.Extensions.WordCountAlgorithm.Loop
member.summary: Uses a simple loop to check characters and count words, this method is faster than regex, but less accurate.

member.name: T:Fluentx.Guard
member.summary: Behavioural presenation of throwing expected exceptions

member.name: M:Fluentx.Guard.Against(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Will throw a if the assertion is true, with the specificied message.
member.param: if set to true [assertion].
The message.
member.example:
Sample usage:
Guard.Against(string.IsNullOrEmpty(name), "Name must have a value");

member.name: M:Fluentx.Guard.Against(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.String)
member.summary: Will throw a if the assertionAction is true, with the specificied message.

member.name: M:Fluentx.Guard.Against``1(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Will throw exception of type with the specified message if the assertion is true
member.param: if set to true [assertion].
The message.
member.example:
Sample usage:
Guard.Against<ArgumentException>(string.IsNullOrEmpty(name), "Name must have a value");

member.name: M:Fluentx.Guard.Against``1(System.Func{System.Boolean},System.String)
member.summary: Will throw exception of type with the specified message if the assertion is true

member.name: T:Fluentx.IMapper`2
member.summary: When overriden it provides functionalities to map from object to object (source to destination) using convention based mapping and a set of custom user rules mapping.

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.Conditional(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1,System.Object}},System.Func{`0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Conditionally maps the specified destination member from the source instance if found according to conditionalAction value.
member.param: The member on destination which will be mapped (its value updated)
The action which its value will determine if to ignore or not mapping this member
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.For``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1,``0}},System.Func{`0,``0})
member.summary: Maps the specified destination member using the specified resolver.
member.param: The member on destination which will be mapped (its value updated)
The func action which will return the value and update the destination member
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.ForIf``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1,``0}},System.Func{`0,``0},System.Func{`0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Maps the specified destination member using the specified resolver if the conditionalAction evaluated to true
member.param: The member on destination which will be mapped (its value updated)
The func action which will return the value and update the destination member
The action which its value will determine if to map using the resolver specified or not mapping this member
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.Ignore(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1,System.Object}})
member.summary: Ignores mapping of the specified destination member
member.param: The member on destination which will be ignored from mapping
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.IgnoreIf(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`1,System.Object}},System.Func{`0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Conditionally ignores the specified destination member from mapping
member.param: The member on destination which will be ignored from mapping
The action which its value will determine if to ignore or not mapping this member
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.UseMapper``2(Fluentx.IMapper{``0,``1})
member.summary: Adds the specified mapper to the list of mappers that will be used in case a name match and types match found during mapping.
member.typeparam: Type of source instance to map from
Type of destination instance to map to
member.param: An instance of a mapper that will be used as a sub mapper in the current mapper in case a match is found for mapping
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.UseMapper``2
member.summary: Creates and adds a new mapper to list of mappers that will be used in case a name match and types match found during mapping.
member.typeparam: Type of source instance to map from
Type of destination instance to map to
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.Resolve(System.Action{`0,`1})
member.summary: Use this method to do custom actions through the mapper, handy to tigh custom resolvings with the mapper. Resolvers are the last things to be executed throught the mapper.
member.param: Custom action to do whatever on the mapper
member.returns: Returns instance of IMapper for chaining purposes

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.Map(`0)
member.summary: Executes mapping and returns the destination instance mapped using the mapping rules specified in the mapper instance.
member.param: The source instance to map from
member.returns: The destination instance which will be returned from the process of mapping

member.name: M:Fluentx.IMapper`2.Map(`0,`1)
member.summary: Executes mapping between source and destination instances
